description: The Learning Records Service is a register of learners which education providers use to create or collect a unique learner number (ULN) for anyone over the age of 14 in UK education and training.
title: Learning Record Service: unique learner numbers (ULNs) created

department.title: Department for Business, Innovation and Skills

transaction.title: Learning Record Service: unique learner numbers (ULNs) created

description-extra: The transactions counted here include the total number of ULNs created, which consists of batch uploads and individually created ULNs.
costs: The cost per transaction figure has been calculated using an apportioned cost for the volume of ULN transactions, based on the total transaction volumes and cost for the Learning Records Service.

modules.title: Transactions per year
info: Data source: Department for Business, Innovation and Skills

modules.title: Total cost
info: The cost per transaction figure has been calculated using an apportioned cost for the volume of ULN transactions, based on the total transaction volumes and cost for the Learning Records Service.
Data source: Department for Business, Innovation and Skills

Total cost is the overall cost per year of providing a service, including staff, IT and accommodation costs; the total cost is automatically calculated from volume and cost per transaction figures, and some rounding errors may occur.

modules.title: Cost per transaction
info: The cost per transaction figure has been calculated using an apportioned cost for the volume of ULN transactions, based on the total transaction volumes and cost for the Learning Records Service.
Data source: Department for Business, Innovation and Skills
Cost per transaction is the average cost of providing each successfully completed transaction, across all channels. Staff, IT and accommodation costs should be included.
